title: 11+ Vocabulary Challenge
subject: english
description: Advanced vocabulary test focusing on synonyms, antonyms, and word meanings

questions.question: Which word is closest in meaning to 'elaborate'?
questions.explanation: Elaborate means detailed or complicated in design and planning

questions.question: What is the opposite of 'scarce'?
questions.explanation: Scarce means in short supply; abundant means existing in large quantities

questions.question: Which word means 'to make something less severe'?
questions.explanation: Mitigate means to make something less severe, serious, or painful

questions.question: Choose the word that is most similar to 'meticulous':
questions.explanation: Meticulous means showing great attention to detail; being very careful and precise

questions.question: What is the antonym of 'obstinate'?
questions.explanation: Obstinate means stubbornly refusing to change; flexible means willing to change

questions.question: Which word means 'existing everywhere at the same time'?
questions.explanation: Ubiquitous means present, appearing, or found everywhere

questions.question: Choose the synonym for 'tranquil':
questions.explanation: Tranquil means free from disturbance; calm and peaceful

questions.question: What is the opposite of 'frigid'?
questions.explanation: Frigid means extremely cold; scorching means extremely hot

questions.question: Which word means 'to praise enthusiastically'?
questions.explanation: Extol means to praise enthusiastically

questions.question: Choose the word closest in meaning to 'peculiar':
questions.explanation: Peculiar means strange or odd; unusual

questions.question: What is the antonym of 'diminish'?
questions.explanation: Diminish means to make or become less; increase means to make or become greater

questions.question: Which word means 'impossible to understand'?
questions.explanation: Incomprehensible means impossible to understand

questions.question: Choose the synonym for 'voracious':
questions.explanation: Voracious means having a very eager approach to something; insatiable

questions.question: What is the opposite of 'condemn'?
questions.explanation: Condemn means to express complete disapproval; praise means to express approval

questions.question: Which word means 'to make something clear by giving more details'?
questions.explanation: Clarify means to make something clear or easier to understand

questions.question: Choose the word most similar to 'benevolent':
questions.explanation: Benevolent means well-meaning and kindly

questions.question: What is the antonym of 'artificial'?
questions.explanation: Artificial means made by humans rather than occurring naturally; natural is the opposite

questions.question: Which word means 'to spread negative information about someone'?
questions.explanation: Defame means to damage someone's reputation by saying bad things about them

questions.question: Choose the synonym for 'pristine':
questions.explanation: Pristine means in its original condition; unspoiled. Immaculate means perfectly clean

questions.question: What is the opposite of 'concise'?
questions.explanation: Concise means brief and clear; verbose means using more words than necessary
